title: Jaime Hernandez God and Science Return of the Ti-Girls
description:
God and Science - Return of the Ti-Girls

Fantagraphics, 2012, 138 pages

Written and Illustrated by Jaime Hernandez

Portions of this graphic novel appeared in Love and Rockets New Stories Vol. 1 and 2. This version contains 30 new pages.


Originally serialized in Love and Rockets: New Stories, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ti-Girls AdventuresÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ managed to be both a rollickingly creative super-hero joyride (featuring three separate super-teams and over two dozen characters) that ranged from the other side of the universe to MaggieÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s shabby apartment, and a genuinely dramatic fable about madness, grief, and motherhood as Penny CenturyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s decades-long quest to become a genuine super-heroine are finally, and tragically, fulfilled.

In addition to introducing a plethora of wild new characters, God and Science brings in many older characters from JaimeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s universe, some from seemingly throwaway shorter strips and some from MaggieÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s day-to-day world (including some real surprises). The main heroine of the story, forming a bridge between the Ã¢â‚¬Å“realisticÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ Maggie stories and the super-heroic extravaganza is Ã¢â‚¬Å“Angel,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ MaggieÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s sweet-tempered and athletic new roommate and best friend, and now herself an aspiring super-heroine.

Aside from being presented in a large format that really displays Jaime HernandezÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s stunning art, God and Science will be a Ã¢â‚¬Å“directorÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s cutÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ version that includes a full 30 new pages in addition to the original 100-page epic, including four new full-color faux Ti-Girls covers, several expansions of scenes, an epilogue set back in MaggieÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s apartment, and a long fantasy/timewarp sequence that draws the focus back on PennyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s awful predicament
